 Java – Quick Notes 
 
✅ What is Java? 
 
Java is a high-level, object-oriented, platform-independent programming language. 
Developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems in 1995. 
Follows the principle: “Write Once, Run Anywhere (WORA)”. 
 
 
✅ Features of Java 
Platform Independent (runs on any OS with JVM) 
Object-Oriented 
Secure 
Robust 
Multithreading 
Portable 
Distributed 
Simple & Easy to learn 
 
 
 
--- 
 
✅ Components of Java 
 
JVM – Java Virtual Machine (runs the program) 
JRE – Java Runtime Environment (provides libraries) 
JDK – Java Development Kit (compiler + tools) 
 
 

 
--- 
 
✅ Basic Structure of a Java Program 
 
class Main { 
    public static void main(String[] args) { 
        System.out.println("Hello Java"); 
    } 
} 
 
 
--- 
 
✅ Data Types 
 
Primitive types: 
int, float, double, char, boolean, byte, short, long 
 
Non-primitive: 
String, Array, Class, Interface, etc. 
 
 
 
--- 
 
✅ OOP Concepts (Very Important) 
 
1. Encapsulation – Hiding data 
2. Inheritance – One class acquiring properties of another 
3. Polymorphism – Many forms (method overloading/overriding) 

4. Abstraction – Hiding implementation detailts 
--- 
 
✅ Keywords (Common) 
 
class, public, static, void, final, this, super, extends, implements, try, catch 
 
 
 
--- 
 
✅ Exception Handling 
Handled using: 
try { 
   // risky code 
} catch(Exception e) { 
   // handle error 
} 
 
 
--- 
 
✅ Java Applications 
 
Used in: 
 
Web apps 
Mobile apps (Android) 
Desktop apps 
Banking systems 
GamesCloud computing
